channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple lights out. Again., 6th December
item.description:
On 4 December I reported multiple lights out on the bus hut end of the park. They are working now (including the one that hasn't worked in years! ðŸŽ‰) However, now only two lights work on the playground end. A few, by the stone table, have been out for a few weeks and reported previously, but now only 2 work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Erith High Street, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light in park or open space

item.title: This van is parking regularly, almost every day at this spot. It is one of the residents of the estate (flats 84 to 93 block). They block access to delivery van and probably any emergency vehicle that would need access., 6th December
item.description:
I saw the two residents leaving again the van. They stepped out of vehicle and walked with no difficulty so clearly not a disability easier access issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jamaica Road, Bermondsey, Greater London

item.title: Corner of Linnell and Shenley Road regularly used as flytipping spot. Letâ€™s set up a camera to catch the repeat offender., 6th December
item.description:
The corner of Linnell Road and Shenley Road is frequently used as a dumping /flytipping spot. This last week many blue bags of mattress stuffing left and then wind blue the stuffing all over the streets. I cleaned it up. As this is a repeat site, can we set up a camera to record the licence plates and identities of the culprits?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Shenley Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 6th December
item.description:
Suitcases, black plastic bags full of rubbish dumped on pavement at base of tree and on opposite side of the road a cardboard box and packaging. This is a fly tipping hot spot. A camera was fitted because of this some time ago but it hasn't improved the situation. It's either a fake camera, not monitored or the council do not care what the borough looks like. There seems to be no deterrent. Weekly black bin collections need to be reinstated.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brodrick Grove, Abbey Wood
Report on FixMyStreet
